title: The Rest and Be Thankful: An infamous road through 'a mountain in torment'
description: The Rest and Be Thankful is carved into the side of a Scottish mountain with a history of landslips.

title: Colombia ex-leader Uribe's detention splits generations
description: Loyal supporters defend Álvaro Uribe to the hilt but younger Colombians want a fresh start.

title: Sushant Singh Rajput: Rhea Chakraborty on 'media trial' after Bollywood star's death
description: Rhea Chakraborty is facing a hate campaign after the death of Bollywood star Sushant Singh Rajput.

title: Black Lives Matter pushes Japan to confront racism
description: To many Japanese, discrimination against black people has been a foreign problem, but things are changing.

title: Quiz of the week: How did Lionel Messi tell Barcelona he wanted out?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: March on Washington: Protesters reflect on the significance of the march this year
description: Four protesters prepare to take part in this year's march at the height of the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: Coronavirus and schools: What are the risks with reopening?
description: BBC health correspondent Laura Foster explains what schools are doing to keep pupils safe.

title: Seaweed: The food and fuel of the future?
description: The farming of seaweed is accelerating as firms exploit its fast growth and green credentials.

title: I thought I was being kidnapped in Greece - Maguire
description: Manchester United's Harry Maguire says he feared for his life when Greek police arrested him last week.

title: Kyle Rittenhouse: Who is US teen accused of Kenosha Wisconsin protest murders?
description: The suspect fired his gun on a night when armed militias clashed with Black Lives Matter protests.

title: Ian Wright hits back at 'racially driven' abuse
description: After Sky Sports decided to remove three pundits from Soccer Saturday, racial abuse appeared online.

title: England's Jason Roy to miss Pakistan T20 series with left side strain
description: Jason Roy will miss England's Twenty20 series with Pakistan because of a side strain.

title: Sir Ed Davey wins Liberal Democrat leadership race
description: The acting leader will now take on the top job permanently, beating his rival Layla Moran.

title: Paul Pogba: Manchester United midfielder tests positive for coronavirus
description: Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba tests positive for coronavirus, says France manager Didier Deschamps.

title: Llangennech diesel train catches fire after derailing
description: The two workers who were onboard the train have been accounted for and no injuries are reported.

title: Coronavirus in Scotland: Almost 17,500 children tested last week
description: The number of children being tested has soared since schools returned - but only 49 tested positive last week.

title: Coronavirus: Self-isolation payment for low-income workers
description: The benefit will be trialled in some parts of north-west England where coronavirus cases have risen.

title: Coronavirus: Switzerland travellers could face UK quarantine rules
description: Scotland already requires people arriving from the country to self-isolate for 14 days.

title: I'm A Celebrity: ITV confirm show will moves to Gwrych Castle in Wales
description: This year's winner will be crowned the King or Queen of the Castle (instead of the Jungle).

title: Froome relationship good despite Tour omission, says Brailsford
description: Sir Dave Brailsford says his relationship with Chris Froome is "as good as ever" despite leaving him out of Team Ineos' Tour de France squad.

title: Hurricane Laura causes flash flooding as it makes landfall in Louisiana
description: The storm, one of the strongest to hit the US Gulf Coast, causes flash flooding and power cuts.

title: The Archers: Radio 4 soap returns to the studio after lockdown criticism
description: Radio 4's soap is back in the studio, after criticisms of the show's lockdown episodes.

title: Apple Fortnite players left behind in new update
description: The new season of Epic's popular game does not - and will not - appear on any Apple devices.

title: West Mathewson: South African conservationist killed by white lions
description: Police say two lions attacked the lodge owner as he was taking them for a walk, in front of his wife.

title: NBA, MLB and MLS postpone games after Milwaukee Bucks' walkout over Jacob Blake shooting
description: After the Milwaukee Bucks cancel a fixture over the shooting of Jacob Blake, other basketball, football and tennis players follow suit.

title: Jacob Blake shooting: WNBA teams protest with 'bullet hole' T-shirts
description: WNBA players from the Atlanta Dream and Washington Mystics join protests against the shooting of Jacob Blake, wearing T-shirts with holes in them representing how many times he was shot by police.

title: Boris Johnson hires personal trainer Harry Jameson
description: The prime minister has previously said he was "too fat" when he was hospitalised with coronavirus.

title: Christchurch mosque attack: Brenton Tarrant sentenced to life without parole
description: The judge called the actions of a man who murdered 51 people last year in two mosques "inhuman".

title: Fan Tales: The Pakistan super fan who's 'living the dream' following his team
description: In the latest episode in our Fan Tales series, we meet a Pakistan super fan who's desperate for his country's cricket fans stand out.

title: Katy Perry and Orlando Bloom announce birth of first child Daisy Dove Bloom
description: The couple said they were "floating with love and wonder" after the arrival of Daisy Dove Bloom.

title: West End 'eccentric's' bizarre collection sold at auction
description: Tony Parker's possessions included a full-scale model zebra and a fossilised walrus penis bone.

title: Everything Everything: The kings of bizarre DIY music videos
description: Everything Everything say it's love, not money, that makes a good video.

title: US Open: No asterisk next to 2020 titles - Martina Navratilova
description: American legend Martina Navratilova says this year's US Open titles will not be devalued by the absence of several top players in New York.

title: Richard Osman: 'I wish I were cooler but I'm not'

title: Coronavirus: Vaccine front-runner China already inoculating workers
description: Chinese health officials say they used emergency powers to secretly test unapproved vaccines.

title: 'Mum died of cancer - now I must care for my brother'

title: Swanage RNLI lifeboat rescue recreated by 11-year-old animator
description: The animation about a Swanage lifeboat launch has been viewed more than 100,000 times.
